name: Retappd
author: Jayden Sibert

sections.description: The Retappd plugin can be used to display a user’s most recent checkins in a post or a page by the use of a shortcode. You can choose what pieces of Untappd checkin information that you would like to display in the plugin’s settings. Example usage of the shortcode is as follows: [retappd].
sections.installation:
1. Download the plugin and unzip it. Upload the full directory into your wp-content/plugins directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Sign Up for Untappd API keys if you do not already have them (http://untappd.com/api/register)
  4. Visit your Retappd Settings (Settings – Retappd)
  5. Configure required Retappd options (Untappd Client ID, Client Secret and username is mandatory)
  6. NOTE: The username MUST HAVE Untappd user checkin activity. If not, there isn’t anything to display.
  7. Place the Retappd shortcode on the pages that you want to give users access to the Untappd user feed: [retappd]

short_description: The Retappd plugin displays a user's Untappd checkins in a post or a page by the use of a shortcode.
